questions.question: Define energy.
questions.answer: Energy is the capacity or ability to do work. It exists in various forms and can be converted from one form to another.

questions.question: What is kinetic energy? Write its formula.
questions.answer: Kinetic energy is the energy possessed by a body due to its motion. Formula: KE = ½mv², where m is mass and v is velocity.

questions.question: What is potential energy? Give two types.
questions.answer: Potential energy is the energy stored in a body due to its position or configuration. Types: (1) Gravitational PE (due to height), (2) Elastic PE (due to deformation like in springs).

questions.question: State the law of conservation of energy.
questions.answer: Energy can neither be created nor destroyed. It can only be transformed from one form to another. The total energy of an isolated system remains constant.

questions.question: Define power and write its SI unit.
questions.answer: Power is the rate of doing work or the rate of energy transfer. Power = Work/Time. SI unit is Watt (W), where 1 W = 1 J/s.

questions.question: What is mechanical energy?
questions.answer: Mechanical energy is the sum of kinetic energy and potential energy of a body. ME = KE + PE. In the absence of friction, mechanical energy is conserved.

questions.question: Differentiate between renewable and non-renewable energy sources.
questions.answer: Renewable sources are continuously replenished naturally (solar, wind, hydro) and won't run out. Non-renewable sources have limited reserves and take millions of years to form (coal, petroleum, natural gas).

questions.question: Why does kinetic energy depend on the square of velocity?
questions.answer: From work-energy theorem, KE = ½mv². The v² dependence comes from the physics of acceleration: stopping distance is proportional to v², and work = force × distance. Doubling velocity quadruples the energy.

questions.question: What is 1 kilowatt-hour? Express it in joules.
questions.answer: 1 kilowatt-hour (kWh) is the energy consumed when a device of power 1 kW operates for 1 hour. 1 kWh = 1000 W × 3600 s = 3,600,000 J = 3.6 MJ. It's the commercial unit of electrical energy.

questions.question: Explain energy transformation in a hydroelectric power plant.
questions.answer: Water stored at height has gravitational PE → Water falls, PE converts to KE → Moving water rotates turbines (mechanical energy) → Turbines drive generators → Mechanical energy converts to electrical energy.
